column4: drew  I'm running KDE, but I believe your looking for the /etc/xdg/menus/applications.menu file which.. if I recall is an XML document that lists the menu structure in GNOME since 2.8 methinks
yes, that looks like it has the menus, great starting point, thanks!
- any file, I want it to open as if I navigated to the directory (slowly) with the 'file browser' and then double-clicked on it.  Is there something that will do that?
support for opening files from the CL is provided by the app itself
Assuming it's an executab;e file, just type the name of the app, but you may need the path as well
if it's a document, you may have to call the file as an argument to the program you want to open it with
it can, but it is more specific thatn just an open call
that's FUD bull... linux isn't harder than windows, you'd have just as much trouble on windows if the XP driver was broken for your wireless card
I agree.. there's just more usuers on windows, so "my driver is broken on windows" gets more attention, faster, than "my driver is broken on linux"....
that too is a crap argument.... there is much more community support for linux than there is for windows
that sure must make life interesting!
lol   that last one about being an engineer did  ;)
I agree, I want the official release today :(
I should grep my log cause I don't recall him talking before he spoke to me  lol
you mispelled your own name   lol
